intro: Isodon alborubrus, commonly known as the red-stemmed honeysuckle, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, reddish stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Isodon alborubrus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
